SEARCH
Package models

Class MiniMaxAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
models.MiniMaxAlgorithm
public class MiniMaxAlgorithm extends Object
Implements the MiniMax algorithm for determining optimal moves in Jumpy3.

This class handles both White (maximizing player) and Black (minimizing player) perspectives through recursive depth-first search. Uses a provided StaticEstimator for position evaluation.

Key functionality:

  • Supports configurable search depth
  • Tracks total positions evaluated during search
  • Handles terminal states and empty move lists

  • Method Details

    • computeBestMove

      public Result computeBestMove(Board board, int depth, Player player)
      Initiates MiniMax search to find optimal move for specified player
      Parameters:
      board - Initial board state
      depth - Search depth (one turn by one player)
      player - WHITE (maximizing) or BLACK (minimizing)
      Returns:
      Result containing best move, estimate, and evaluation metrics

    • minimax

      private Result minimax(Board board, int depth, boolean isMaximizing, Player currentPlayer)
      Recursive MiniMax implementation with depth-limited search
      Parameters:
      board - Current board state
      depth - Remaining search depth
      isMaximizing - True for White's maximizing turn, false for Black's minimizing
      currentPlayer - Player making the current move
      Returns:
      Best result for current search subtree
